channel.title: iPhone troubles
channel.description: Hey guys, I bought an iPhone a while back (2 months now).. However, I was being sent to Western Australia for 15 days for training, and I wasn't going to be reachable by phone and mum had lost hers. I lent my iPhone to her while she went over to Canada for a holiday (if it means anything, she stayed in Whistler). She gave it back and now it won't charge, it's just completely useless. A handy paperweight, I guess. I couldn't work out why, but then I wondered if her charging it in Canada would affect the battery somehow? Just wondering if anyone knew anything.

item.title: iPhone troubles
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:21, topic:325887”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=422297.msg3100854#msg3100854 date=1263694950]

However, I was being sent to Western Australia for 15 days for training

I R CURIOUS FEED ME!

[me=Yz85Racer]feeds goatee.[/me]

Let’s not be all funny about this, what were you training for?
[/quote][/quote]
I wasn’t “training” technically; I was taking the TAG (East)'s screening process to get into Tactical Assault of the Australian Navy. Unfortunately, I failed at day 10 and was medically discharged for 2 months because I got glandular fever.

fyi: http://www.youtube.com/user/AussietheAustralian

Read full topic

item.title: iPhone troubles
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“Cbot, post:19, topic:325887”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=422297.msg3100196#msg3100196 date=1263661303]
take it to apple store, they should replace it dont mention its been to canada though
[/quote]
If anything a new iPhone charger is only like $5-$10[/quote]

I doubt that would work as he has said upon plugging the iPhone into the computer nothing happens, so it’s most likely not the charger.

Read full topic

sanga282:

take it to apple store, they should replace it dont mention its been to canada though

Yup warranty should cover it, but knowing apple they’ll probably try and turn it around and blame you for an extra buck
If anything a new iPhone charger is only like $5-$10

la­wl:

That is what I thought, apparently not though.

lol @ another australian going to Whistler, they’re going to take the fucking place over.

item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

I don’t know why you guys didn’t think about using an adapter or anything, ;P, but anyway, send it out to Apple.

or sell it to some random person and tell them they just need to charge it and it’ll be fine.

item.title: iPhone troubles
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

sanga282:

different voltages over the mains? if you didnt have an appropriate adapter it might’ve stopped it from working. Also check the charging socket on the phone itself, if there’s like a little bit of fluff in there in the wrong place it wont charge

This is your answer, without a doubt. I know for sure the voltages are different in Europe, but different voltages in Australia are definitely a possibility.

Read full topic

item.title: iPhone troubles
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:7, topic:325887”]Canada: ~110volts@60hz
Australia: ~240volts@50hz

That refresh rate must have fucked it over. You should complain because most phone chargers should do 110-250volts@50-60hz. My £20 phone can so why should some £400 pound smartphone fail like that.[/quote]
Another thing ruined by Canada. gj

Read full topic

Australia: ~240volts@50hz
